definition: a transition (stop and change) in spoken sound, music or in brush strokes/a cadence/punctuated by a transition/with syncopated cadence (brush stroke in painting)
to stop/to pause/to arrange/to lay out/to kowtow/to stamp (one's foot)/at once/classifier for meals, beatings, scoldings etc: time, bout, spell, meal
obstructed/to fail/to oppress/to repress/to lower the tone/to bend back/to dampen
see 頓挫抑揚|顿挫抑扬[dun4 cuo4 yi4 yang2]
cadence/modulation

sentences.english: In a poem, cadences are arranged in regular sequence.
sentences.chinese: 在一首诗里，抑扬顿挫是按一定顺序配置的。

sentences.english: Tibetan folk song cadence, rhyme Hezhe paste, attractive.
sentences.chinese: 藏族民歌抑扬顿挫，合辙贴韵，悦耳动听。

sentences.english: Cantabile years of time walking and cadence.
sentences.chinese: 如歌岁月因时间的行走而抑扬顿挫。

sentences.english: Her voice had a soft Welsh lilt to it.
sentences.chinese: 她讲话的声音柔和而抑扬顿挫，有些威尔士口音。

sentences.english: The lack of liquidity is amplifying these moves.
sentences.chinese: 流动性的缺乏正让这些顿挫得到强化。

sentences.english: You don't know what I'm saying if I say it in a flat tone.
sentences.chinese: 如果我说话没有抑扬顿挫，你也不会明白我在说什么。

sentences.english: Melody refer to the voice of the original cadence, is a spiritual experience.
sentences.chinese: 韵原来是指声音的抑扬顿挫，是一种心灵的感受。

sentences.english: He read the poems with cadence.
sentences.chinese: 他抑扬顿挫地朗诵诗歌。

sentences.english: His recitation was cadenced and rich in feeling .
sentences.chinese: 他的朗颂抑扬顿挫，富有感情。

sentences.english: Churchill's cadences began to roll out of the short-wave radio .
sentences.chinese: 短波电台里开始传出邱吉尔那抑扬顿挫的声调。

sentences.english: Happily that monopoly turned into a commodity that even ordinary, unschooled people could have.
sentences.chinese: 开心垄断变成一种商品，连普通的民众可以顿挫。

sentences.english: Liu Wei courtyards and layout, but also voice, though covertly .
sentences.chinese: 而刘炜庭院里的布置，却也抑扬顿挫，暗合音律。

sentences.english: It was the voice of a born orator, rich in possible modulations .
sentences.chinese: 这是一个天生演说家的富于抑扬顿挫的声音。

definition: (of a car) to slip out of gear/to pop out of gear
modulation (rising and falling pitch)/intonation/a cadence/to rise and fall (of a body floating in water)
clutch (in car gearbox)/separation and reunion
to put into gear/to engage the gear/gear change
to wield the pen/to write
sold out/out of stock
cadence/modulation
see 頓挫抑揚|顿挫抑扬[dun4 cuo4 yi4 yang2]
the tip of a writing brush/vigor of style in writing/stroke/touch
oblique attack (brush movement in painting)
stiff/dull
strokes of a Chinese character
vigor of strokes in calligraphy or drawing/vigor of style in literary composition
technique of writing/calligraphy/or drawing
to brake (when driving)/to stop/to switch off/to check (bad habits)/a brake
see 一倡三歎|一倡三叹[yi1 chang4 san1 tan4]
